skill.name: commit
skill.description: Create commit messages following Sentry conventions. Use when committing code changes, writing commit messages, or formatting git history. Follows conventional commits with Sentry-specific issue references.
skill.summary: Create commit messages following Sentry conventions. Use when committing code changes, writing commi...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation with no executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. It provides guidelines for formatting git commit messages following Sentry conventions.

content.value_statement: Writing clear, consistent commit messages improves code review and tracks changes effectively. This skill provides templates and rules for generating professional commit messages that follow Sentry engineering standards.
actual_capabilities: Generate commit messages with type, scope, and subject format
Format body text explaining what and why of changes
Create issue references using Sentry, GitHub, and Linear patterns
Handle breaking changes with proper footer notation
Apply 100-character line limits and 70-character subject rules
Write reverts with original commit hash and reason
limitations: Does not execute git commands or create commits automatically
Does not validate existing commit history or branch names
Does not integrate with CI/CD systems or issue trackers
Does not generate changelogs or release notes

use_cases.title: Contribute to Sentry projects
use_cases.description: Follow official commit conventions when submitting pull requests to Sentry repositories

use_cases.title: Enforce team standards
use_cases.description: Establish consistent commit message patterns across development teams

use_cases.title: Learn professional conventions
use_cases.description: Understand proper git commit practices used by large-scale software projects

prompt_templates.title: Simple fix commit
prompt_templates.scenario: Fix a bug in API code
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a commit message for fixing a bug where the user API returns null for deleted accounts, causing dashboard crashes. Include null check before accessing user properties. Reference SENTRY-5678.

prompt_templates.title: Feature with scope
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a commit message for adding Slack thread replies for alert updates. Group notifications by replying to original threads instead of creating new messages. Reference GH-1234.

prompt_templates.title: Breaking change
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a commit message for removing deprecated v1 API endpoints deprecated in version 23.1. Include breaking change notation. Reference SENTRY-9999.

prompt_templates.title: Documentation update
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a commit message for updating README installation instructions with new system requirements. Keep it concise under 70 characters.

output_examples.input: Create a commit message for fixing a race condition in the authentication service that allowed users to access other accounts briefly. Add token validation check before session creation. Reference AUTH-1234.
output: fix(auth): Add token validation check before session creation
Race condition allowed brief access to wrong accounts after login.
Add synchronous token validation before establishing user session.
Prevents cross-account access during concurrent authentication attempts.

best_practices: Use imperative mood in subject line: Add feature not Added feature
Explain what changed and why, not how the change was implemented
Reference issues using Fixes to close them or Refs to link without closing
anti_patterns: Using past tense in subject line: Added feature instead of Add feature
Exceeding 70 characters in subject line or 100 characters per line
Including implementation details or code snippets in commit messages

faq.question: What commit types does this skill support?
faq.answer: feat, fix, ref, perf, docs, test, build, ci, chore, style, meta, and license for repository metadata changes.

faq.question: Can this skill create actual git commits?
faq.answer: No. This skill generates properly formatted commit message text. You must run git commit command yourself.

faq.question: Which issue reference formats work?
faq.answer: Sentry uses GH-1234 for GitHub issues, SENTRY-1234 for internal issues, and LINEAR-ABC-123 for Linear issues.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains only documentation. It does not access files, execute code, or transmit data over networks.

faq.question: How do breaking changes work?
faq.answer: Add exclamation mark after type and scope: feat(api)!: Description. Include BREAKING CHANGE footer explaining migration path.

faq.question: What is the difference between ref and refactor?
faq.answer: Sentry uses ref (not refactor) for code restructuring without behavior change. Both follow same format as other commit types.
